item.title: Report X-2024060464
item.description:
Report X-2024060464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLYEE DISCOVERED THE OPEN BOX ITS CONTENTS ON THE BELT LEADING TO PD 2. HE STOPPED THE PROGRESS OF THE PACKAGE AND PLACED THEM ONT THE MISSORT CHUTE. DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE BOTTLES WAS LEAKING. HE CALLED FOR A RESPONDER SOON AFTER DISCOVERY. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. ONE PIECE OF TAPE WAS USED TO SECURE THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE, IT FAILED TO HOLD. THE CONTENTS FELL OUT THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE.

item.description:

  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained three metal jerrycans of UN1866. The shipment didn't have any DG markings or paperwork required for transport. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held at the location.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of ClearCoat Activator was released from two 1-gallon metal pails due to improper loading by terminal XLU. The release impacted trailer #3193872. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024060044
item.description:
Report E-2024060044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 30, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2014 was punctured due to an unknown cause and released approximately 50-gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt/gravel below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel performed a tote transfer and labeled the tote for onsite disposal. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the released product. All waste was containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the agent discovered that one of the metal cans inside released it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. Packaged inside were nine metal cans in a plastic bag. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 23rd a package was found with signs of leakage. The package contained four glass bottles of UN1593, DICHLOROMETHANE, 6.1, III. One of the bottles was shattered causing all of the contents to leak out of the bottle. The package was secured into a salvage drum and the shipper was contacted for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024051716
item.description:
Report X-2024051716

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained five metal cans some with positive closure rings and packaged in plastic bags. The lid came off of on can causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024060206
item.description:
Report X-2024060206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No spill. Undeclared hazmat (no DOT labels or markings on outer packaging). Outer packaging: Torn, opaque, plastic envelope/bag. Inner packaging: 25lb plastic UNPOP Y rated drum of Heze Huayi Chem Co C3 Chlorinating Tablets. No damage to content; outer bag is fully torn. Recommend no bag/envelope as the inner drum is pre-printed with a LQ label. PLEASE NOTE: DGNAV Incident 9490 is the same but was found without a barcode or outer packaging.

item.title: Report X-2024060416
item.description:
Report X-2024060416

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles

item.title: Report X-2024051713
item.description:
Report X-2024051713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Damaged package left in a tote at NASH 371 HWPA. Inspection found that twelve 32-ounce plastic bottles of Purell Foodservice Surface Sanitizer leaked due to loose caps. This shipment received a DPR, repack and RTS at MEML-386. Repack was shipped without a diamond label or other hazmat markings. No DGNav report or ISF was completed at the time of DPR. The original package also appears to have been undeclared.

item.title: Report X-2024060249
item.description:
Report X-2024060249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/18/2024 at approximately 0530, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 355827 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a gasoline spill. The shipment consisted by 2 glass bottles packaged in a fiberboard box. The spill was due to complete leakage of both bottles, resulting in total loss. The cause of the spillage is unknown. The shipment is being disposed of as hazardous waste.
